revised_title: Periodical Laws in Magnetic Disturbances: A Comparative Study of St. Helena and Cape of Good Hope Observatories
tldr: The author investigates periodical laws in larger magnetic disturbances at St. Helena and Cape of Good Hope Observatories, finding that both stations exhibit a similar pattern of disturbances over time. The study reveals a minimum magnetic effect in 1843 and a maximum in 1848, suggesting a global cause for these variations.
